TITLE.P: Advocacy Services in Flintshire and Wrexham.

SHORT_DESCR.P: The purpose of this notice is to assess market interest in working with Flintshire County Council and Wrexham County Borough Council to provide advocacy services in Flintshire and Wrexham, in accordance with their new statutory duties. Denbighshire County Council have also expressed an interest in joining the processes at a later date.
Please see the PIN notice document that is attached to this notice for full details.

Both councils are seeking to commission advocacy services in accordance with the requirements in the Social Services and Well-being (Wales) Act 2014 and the associated Code of Practice. The Regulation and Inspection of Social Care (Wales) Act 2016 brings advocacy service providers within the social services regulation and inspection regime. In addition, "A Place to Call Home” report gave a review into the Quality of Life and Care of Older People living in Care Homes in Wales.

The role of independent advocacy and its importance is neither fully understood nor recognised and there are significant variations in the availability of access to advocacy services. There is little evidence that independent advocacy services are being actively promoted within care homes.
The ability of third sector organisations to deliver independent advocacy services is often affected by unstable and unreliable funding.

Both councils are working with the Golden Thread Advocacy programme, funded by Welsh Government. This work stream will review existing commissioning arrangements for advocacy for all adults over the age of 18 and consider the implications of the new legislation for the 2017-18 commissioning round. Once completed this will inform and develop the new advocacy contracts going forward from April 2018.

INFO_ADD.P: We will be holding a stakeholder engagement event at Connah's Quay Town Council on Monday 27.3.2017. Attendees will include commissioners, providers, social work practitioners, service users and others. Any organisation that wishes to express an interest in providing advocacy services in Flintshire and Wrexham is also welcome to attend the stakeholder workshop.

Any organisations who wish to express an interest in contracting to provide advocacy services from April 2018 should submit a written expression of interest to Valerie Billingham, Programme Development Officer for Commissioning (North Wales), Golden Thread Advocacy Programme, at Valerie.billingham@agecymru.org.uk Val Billingham will forward it to the appropriate Council or Councils. The Councils will then keep organisations informed, engage them in dialogue and issue a formal invitation to tender in due course.
Submissions should be no more than 1 000 words long and should include:

2) Evidence of your organisation's capability to provide advocacy services to people in Flintshire and Wrexham and to contribute to the development of the vision for a flourishing advocacy sector, as detailed in this document. Providers may draw on either direct experience of innovative projects they have been involved with or new models of service they have knowledge of and believe would better meet the needs of individuals who need advocacy in Flintshire and Wrexham;
3) Whether or not you would like to attend the wider stakeholder engagement event being planned for Monday 27.3.2017 at Connah's Quay Town Council.

Acknowledgement of receipt of all submissions will be undertaken by email only. We will ensure that all submissions are kept confidential and are not shared with any third party without express permission. The Councils welcome collaborative proposals and approaches from social enterprises and views this PIN as the beginning of a dialogue with organisations, with the view to include service users also throughout the process. If you would like any further information, please email Valerie.billingham@agecymru.org.uk by Wednesday 15.3.2017.
Note: To register your interest in this notice and obtain any additional information please visit the Sell2Wales Web Site at http://www.sell2wales.gov.wales/Search/Search_Switch.aspx?ID=63110
